intro: Raputia brevipedunculata, commonly known as the short-stemmed raputia, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes plants such as calla lilies and peace lilies. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, arrow-shaped leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a spadix surrounded by a spathe, typical of the arum family. Raputia brevipedunculata is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
